The solution of the equations\\
\begin{align*}
2x-3y&=7 \\ 
4x-6y &=20 \\ 
\end{align*}is:\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ x=18, y=12 \qquad
\textbf{(B)}\ x=0, y=0 \qquad
\textbf{(C)}\ \text{There is no solution} \\
\textbf{(D)}\ \text{There are an unlimited number of solutions} \qquad
\textbf{(E)}\  x=8, y=5$
